intro: Indosasa laotica, commonly known as the Laos indigo plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
